name: Substochastic-sat
tagline: Substochastic Monte Carlo applied to MAX-SAT
body:
# Substochastic-SAT Substochastic Monte Carlo applied to MAX-SAT Substochastic Monte Carlo (SSMC) is a classical algorithm that utilizes time-varied substochastic birth-death chains to solve optimization problems. By slowly varying a chain with some known initial quasi-stationary distribution to one with an unknown QSD, SSMC can often remains close to the instantaneous QSD throughout the entire variation. By choosing a final chain which encodes some optimization problem, if this process succeeds it naturally produces the optimum. This technique is a classical analog of and was inspired by the quantum adiabatic optimization algorithm. _SSMC was supported in part by Booz Allen Hamilton, NIST, and QuICS._ --- >Michael Jarret, Stephen Jordan, and Brad Lackey
[Joint Center for Quantum Information and Computer Science](http://quics.umd.edu/)
[University of Maryland, College Park](http://umd.edu/)
